cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest across the Yucatan Channel into the south-central Gulf, then bending north-northwest toward the Louisiana Gulf Coast late Friday into early Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana Gulf Coast (likely between Morgan City and Lake Charles, with New Orleans area in eastern semicircle)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to western Cuba; none yet along U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings along NE Yucatan Peninsula and Pinar del Rio Cuba; none yet for U.S. coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds increasingly likely late Friday into Saturday (34-kt probability up to 52%, 50-kt up to 25%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–6 ft possible along southeast Louisiana coast and Lake Pontchartrain if the center tracks just west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk in the greater New Orleans area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; very rough seas and dangerous currents in approaches to the Lower Mississippi River.
